entry.title: Speedy Trial
entry.summary: The email thread on the bitcoin-dev mailing list includes a discussion about the Speedy Trial deployment design and concerns raised by different factions. The original proposer of the design mentions that it was created to address miner-veto concerns and other factions' worries. However, one participant expresses disappointment that their "yes-user-veto" faction was not considered. The designer argues that the short timeline of Speedy Trial addresses the "no-miner-veto" concerns. The thread also discusses the idea of forced signaling championed by luke-jr, but this proposal did not get broad consensus due to the risk of knocking a significant fraction of mining power offline. Another solution discussed is an easy mechanism for users to actively oppose a proposal. The thread also briefly touches on mark's quantum computing concerns.
